arbitrate(bytes32,uint256).details: Callable only when timelock has passedonlyOwnerisRequested

params.choice: index of the chosen desiredOutcome from dispute.choices

claimLapse(bytes32).details: Callable when a dispute has lapsed. Also hides this arbitrator in ArbitratorFactoryisRequested

init(bytes).details: initializer_newOwner | Address to immediately transfer ownership to_fee | Arbitration fee (per disputer) in wei_lapse | Seconds after timelock ends when a Dispute is considered to have "lapsed"

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

requestArbitration(address,uint256,uint2.details: Callable only during Solver timelockOnly callable by recipients of the Solver conditionOnly callable while Solver condition is Status.OutcomeProposed or Status.ArbitrationRequested

params.conditionIndex: Index of condition for which arbitration is being requested
params.outcomes: Outcome report being requested by the disputer

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

arbitrateNull(bytes32).notice: Deliver a null arbitration. Resets disputes and choices to empty arrays and reimburses disputers

claimLapse(bytes32).notice: Delivers arbitration as the Keeper's proposed report and refunds all disputers who requested arbitration

extendLapse(bytes32,uint256).notice: Add additional lapse duration to an active dispute

getFee(address,uint256).notice: If Dispute already exists, returns the fee from when was created. Else, the current fee

getTimelock(bytes32).notice: Gets timelock of the condition being disputed

init(bytes).notice: Sets fee and immediately transfers ownership to _newOwner

isLapsed(bytes32).notice: True when a dispute has lapsed

requestArbitration(address,uint256,uint2.notice: Receives an arbitration request from a disputer

setFee(uint256).notice: Set a new arbitration fee. Does not affect active Disputes

setLapse(uint256).notice: Set a new lapse duration. Does not affect active Disputes

withdraw().notice: Withdraws ETH and reduces balance of msg.sender
